personal.name: Aniket Poojari
personal.title: Machine Learning Engineer
personal.subtitle: Building Intelligent Systems that Scale from Research to Production
bio: Machine Learning Engineer with 2+ years of hands on experience building high impact AI systems.
Specialized in diffusion models, LLMs, agentic automation, and scalable ML pipelines.
Built distributed multi GPU training systems and autonomous research agents used to cut hours into minutes.
Focused on shipping production ready AI that is fast, reliable, and impossible to ignore.

projects.title: Agentic AI Research Assistant
projects.description: Architected an autonomous multi-agent research system using LangGraph, reducing complex research workflows from hours to minutes through automated web search, summarization, fact-checking, and citation management tools. Achieved 99.9% response quality and a 100% test pass rate across LangSmith-guided evaluations with flawless trajectory execution in 6-step workflows. Deployed a dual-interface architecture (FastAPI backend, Streamlit frontend) with a Docker + GitHub Actions CI/CD pipeline, ensuring zero-downtime deployment to Hugging Face Spaces.

projects.title: BiLoRA: Dual Adapter Fine-Tuning
projects.description: Fine-tuned Phi-3 Mini 4K model on code generation and docstring generation tasks using LoRA, PEFT, and 4-bit BitsAndBytes quantization, reducing inference latency by 30% and GPU memory usage by 75% enabling consumer-grade GPU deployment. Developed a dual-adapter architecture, enabling instant task switching in deployed apps without model reloads, and significantly improving user responsiveness over traditional single-adapter or reload workflows.

projects.title: Multi-Modal RAG QA System
projects.description: Built a production Flask-LangChain-ChromaDB pipeline integrated with Groq's Llama 4 Scout multimodal LLM, enabling automated semantic search and Q&A across PDFs and websites that reduced document analysis time by 70%. Engineered a dual-layer RAG architecture that vectorizes LLM-generated descriptions of tables and images for semantic search while preserving original data (base64 images, structured tables) in metadata, enabling context-aware retrieval and accurate cross-format querying, boosting multi-modal query accuracy by 30% compared to text-only workflows.

projects.title: Text-to-Image Diffusion Model (From Scratch)
projects.description: Built a distributed training pipeline for a diffusion model involving UNet (Denoising), CLIP (Text Embedding), and VAE (Compression) using DeepSpeed on AWS SageMaker, achieving 3× training speedup on 8K image-caption pairs through efficient multi-GPU parallelization and mixed-precision training. Orchestrated automated training workflow with Apache Airflow and MLflow (DagsHub), implementing reproducible pipeline execution with automated model versioning, experiment tracking, and loss metric monitoring.

projects.title: Text Summarization GPT from Scratch
projects.description: Pretrained a 125M-parameter transformer for summarization. Fine-tuned on XSum dataset, achieving a 5.4 ROUGE score.

projects.title: Monocular Depth Estimation
projects.description: Designed a Vision Transformer (ViT) encoder with a convolutional decoder for single-image depth prediction, enabling accurate depth maps for 3D reconstruction and autonomous navigation. Implemented a fully reproducible PyTorch + DVC + MLflow training workflow on the Cityscapes dataset, achieving production-ready depth estimation with an average 19 cm error (RMSE).

projects.title: Automated Stock Price Prediction System
projects.description: Built a CNN-based stock price prediction model with XGBoost for feature selection, improving accuracy and reproducibility.

projects.title: Lane Segmentation
projects.description: Developed a U-Net model for lane detection in autonomous vehicles, achieving 80% IoU and integrated into a Flask app for real-time use.

projects.title: Motor Self Inspection
projects.description: A web app that detects vehicle damages for faster insurance claim approvals.

projects.title: Image Denoising
projects.description: Used an autoencoder neural network for effective image denoising.

projects.title: NYC Taxi Trip duration prediction
projects.description: Created a prediction system to estimate taxi trip durations in New York City using CatBoost, with XGBoost assisting in feature selection.

projects.title: Sentiment Analysis of tweets
projects.description: Conducted sentiment analysis on airline-related tweets by implementing an LSTM model in PyTorch.

projects.title: Emergency VS Non Emergency Vehicle Sound Classification
projects.description: Developed a sound classification system using an LSTM model on spectrogram features with TensorFlow to distinguish between emergency and non-emergency vehicles.

projects.title: Movie Recommendation
projects.description: Engineered a hybrid recommendation system that combines content-based and collaborative filtering approaches.

projects.title: Subway Surfers CNN
projects.description: Developed a CNN model in PyTorch to autonomously play the Subway Surfers game.

projects.title: Human Computer Interaction Using Hand Gestures and Voice
projects.description: Created an interactive system that enables computer control using hand gestures and voice commands.

projects.title: Insomnia Chatbot
projects.description: Designed an AI-powered chatbot with an intent-based model to interact with users and execute commands.

projects.title: 2048 Using Speech Command Identification
projects.description: Created a CNN model in PyTorch to interpret live voice inputs as commands for controlling the 2048 game.

projects.title: Cricket Shot Classification
projects.description: Utilized Keypoint R-CNN pretrained on the COCO keypoint dataset to extract keypoints from images, which were then used to train a Neural Network for classifying cricket shot poses.

projects.title: Texture Generation
projects.description: Designed and implemented a DC-GAN to generate realistic textures from scratch.

projects.title: Translating Text From Russian To English With Attention
projects.description: Developed an encoder-decoder model with an attention mechanism to translate Russian text to English.

Data Shift in Machine Learning: Understanding, Detecting, and Addressing Challenges

highlights: Built a Python pipeline to clean and transform brainwave recordings into features and trained machine learning models to predict which movement a person is imagining (left hand, right hand, foot, tongue) from EEG signals

Developed reusable Python tools to load, standardize, and label brainwave data from OpenBCI headsets and public datasets, creating training/evaluation datasets and iterating on baseline classifiers to improve imagined-movement detection accuracy
Led deployment of a secure on-premise RAG chatbot and LLM infrastructure, reducing internal support ticket resolution time from 3 days to 1 day while ensuring complete enterprise data privacy

Engineered a scalable full-stack MOOC platform using a TypeScript monorepo with 4 microservices; built secure REST APIs (Express, MongoDB, S3) and modern React frontends (Redux Toolkit, TanStack Query), enabling course delivery, progress tracking, threaded comments, and automated certificate generation via Puppeteer
Supported ML and Cloud Computing courses by building and maintaining PyTorch/Scikit-learn lab environments on GCP and Colab for 300+ students, ensuring smooth execution of experiments
Refactored and standardized 15+ lab notebooks with version control and reproducible pipelines, streamlining grading and reducing student runtime errors by 35%
Built ML pipelines for block-trade allocation and forecasting, cutting allocation error rates by 15% and improving forecast accuracy by 20%
Automated data infrastructure using Docker and PostgreSQL, increasing data retrieval speed by 75% and reducing system downtime by 30%
Leveraged Apache Spark to analyze gigabytes of trading data, detecting discrepancies and boosting strategy testing accuracy by 50%
Implemented automated trade-cleansing workflows (Random Forest, XGBoost), cutting manual workload by 30% and enhancing model reliability by 25%
Automated vehicle damage detection in insurance claims by training a Mask R-CNN model, raising detection accuracy by 18% and cutting manual claim processing by 45%
Integrated ML workflows into the Django-based claims system, reducing overall claim processing time by 35%

Relevant Coursework: Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Algorithms, Machine Learning

achievements.title: Smart India Hackathon 2019 Runner-Up
achievements.description: Selected as top 2 finalist team. Led development of Smart Research Content Management System designed at P.D. Hinduja Hospital Research Center for automating PhD/MSc student project workflows.

achievements.title: IEEE Publication
achievements.description: "Human Computer Interaction using Hand Gestures and Voice," IEEE Xplore, 2019 | 255 full-text views, 3 citations – Proposed multimodal gesture-voice interface using computer vision for device-free assistive technology applications.

testimonials.name: Vivek Kashyap
testimonials.content: Aniket is well focused, hardworking as well as a solution oriented guy. In his term of internship he and team has solved the assigned problem very well before the given timeline. The assigned project was designed and developed by them as expected and meeting all the requirements. I'll highly recommend him, he is good team contributor, very productive, good and can be great problem solver. Best Wishes
